DOCNAME: CASE OF AYANGİL AND OTHERS v. TURKEY
JUDGES: András Sajó;Françoise Tulkens;Helen Keller;Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre;Paulo Pinto De Albuquerque
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were born in DATE , DATE , DATE and DATE respectively and live in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the authorities adopted a new local construction plan ( imar şuyulandırması ) and decided to merge plots nos . CARDINAL , DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE and DATE and to register them as plot no . DATE in the GPE neighbourhood in the GPE district of GPE . Previously the applicants’ predecessors had been the owners of plot no . CARDINAL . Following the implementation of the said plan , the applicants’ predecessors had kept a share measuring QUANTITY on plot no . CARDINAL ( which measures QUANTITY in total ) , and owned a CARDINAL - storey house on the plot in question . Given that the aforementioned decision designated plot no . CARDINAL as a school area and indicated that the buildings on this plot would be expropriated , the applicants’ predecessor , Mr PERSON , moved out of his house in DATE .

CARDINAL . NORP In a letter dated DATE the deputy director of ORG attached to ORG ( hereinafter “ the ORG ” ) sent a letter to the ORG predecessors , informing them that their building would be expropriated since the ORG was planning to build a primary school on the land on which it was situated . The ORG also noted that a commission would proceed to the determination of the value of the applicants’ building and its annexes .
CARDINAL . Subsequently , the ORG built the school . However , the ORG did not conclude the expropriation proceedings for the applicants’ building , which remained in the schoolyard .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG predecessor filed a petition with the ORG requesting the return of his plot of land , which had been occupied since the decision of expropriation in DATE and the construction of the school . He noted that despite the expropriation decision , the authorities had done nothing despite continuing to occupy his plot of land and that this situation had restricted his right to the enjoyment of his property . He therefore asked the authorities to overturn the decision ordering expropriation . It is unknown whether the ORG replied to the petition .

CARDINAL . In DATE , after inheriting the property in question , the applicants brought an action seeking a declaratory judgment ( tespit davası ) before ORG to the effect that their building was situated in the schoolyard . ORG appointed an expert , who found that the building in question was indeed situated in the zone belonging to ORG .

CARDINAL . The applicants brought an action before ORG of First Instance against ORG for compensation . They submitted , inter alia , that the ORG was in actual possession of their property , without having conducted expropriation proceedings , and had failed to compensate them for the damage resulting from the interference with their property .

CARDINAL . NORP In a letter dated DATE the ORG informed ORG of First Instance that the LOC was situated in block no . CARDINAL , plot no . CARDINAL , and that the applicants owned a share of that plot measuring CARDINAL out of a total of QUANTITY . It noted further that , in the local building and settlement plan , plot no . CARDINAL had been designated as a primary school zone and that the building and share of the land of the applicants had not been expropriated .
CARDINAL . ORG of First Instance appointed an expert , who conducted an on - site inspection . According to his report of DATE , the building in question was situated in the schoolyard .

CARDINAL . On DATE the First ORG partially granted the ORG request for compensation and ordered ORG office to pay the applicants MONEY ( TRL ) . Relying particularly on the annotations in the land registry and the response given by the ORG as well as other evidence contained in the file , the court found it established that the administrative authorities were in actual possession of the applicants’ property .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the judgment of DATE , considering that the GPE Governor ’s office could not be considered to have been in actual possession of the applicants’ building , since the administrative authorities had not prevented the applicants from using the building in question . ORG further noted that the fact that the building was in the schoolyard did not necessarily mean that there had been a de facto expropriation , and concluded that the applicants’ request should be dismissed . The case was remitted to ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the First Instance Court abided by ORG decision and dismissed the ORG request . In its decision , the court noted that the school building and the building belonging to the applicants were both on plot no . DATE , which was used by the applicants themselves . The court therefore found that there had not been a de facto expropriation even though plot no . CARDINAL had been allocated to the primary school in the local building and settlement plan ( imar planı ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment of CARDINAL DATE .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the applicants requested the rectification of ORG decision of DATE , claiming that there were clerical errors as well as errors of law in the decision .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG granted the applicants’ request and decided to rectify the clerical errors .

CARDINAL . In their observations , the applicants submitted that following the communication of the present to the ORG , the authorities had brought road blocks to the school yard with a view to delimiting the school yard from the applicants’ house . In this connection the applicants furnished photos taken on DATE .

CARDINAL . NORP In a letter dated DATE , furnished by the Government , the mayor of the neighbourhood ( muhtar ) stated that there were currently a number of tenants living in the applicants’ house situated in the yard of the LOC primary school .

CARDINAL . According to section CARDINAL of the Expropriation Law no . ORG , as amended in DATE , when an expropriation decision was taken in respect of an immovable property , the administrative authorities shall inform the relevant land registry office for annotation of the said decision in the register . However , if the authority fails to furnish the land registry office , within DATE of the annotation , with a document to be obtained from a court indicating that it had determined the price and requested the registration of the immovable property , the land registry office shall automatically remove the annotation .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL of the LAW stipulates that the administrative authorities shall be liable to compensate for damage resulting from their actions and acts . LAW no . CARDINAL on administrative procedure provides that any person who has suffered damage as a result of an act committed by the administrative authorities may request compensation from them . In the event of complete or partial rejection of a compensation request , or if no reply has been received within a time - limit of DATE , the person involved may initiate administrative proceedings .
